fields.summary: Extending DescribeVMTypes to Support Restricting Views of VM Types via IAM

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Currently, a user without any IAM permissions can view VM types either by using CLI or going directly to the URL (https://<clc>:8443#vmtype:) in the admin console.
fields.summary: DescribeVMTypes needs to be integrated with IAM

comments.body:
commit 69b0edf1a710421b375ab28a69c2f34cb5b7ff77
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Wed May 15 11:58:40 2013 -0700

    Fixes to instance type handling, syntax, ordering
    
    Changes are properly persisted and re-read from the database.
    So, a modify will be saved, and after failover/upgrade/restart
    be re-read correctly.
    
    Along with this persisting of changes using the UI is fixed.
    
    The name of the operations are now fixed to be InstanceType
    rather than VmType.  Corresponding adjust made in euca2ools
    and included here are for the console and autoscaling.
    
    Type ordering restriction is relaxed in the following way:
    - Instance types are not /required/ to be partial ordered
    - Instances types which are /not/ partially ordered are
      treated as a degenerate case.
    - The system determines the set of partially ordered types
      and as long as run-instance requests during a duty cycle
      only refer to ordered types the system behaves as it did
      before.
    - Should an unordered type be requested, or be inflight when
      any other run-instance request arrives, the request will
      be preceded by and immediately followed by a CC downcall
      to update resource state information.  Note that only the
      preceding resource state update happens synchronously.
    - The state updates must happen whenever there is an as-yet-
      unfulfilled request that references an unordered type.
      Otherwise, the ordered type resource accounting is skewed.
    - Below is a script for computing the set of conflicting or
      unordered instance types and could serve as the basis for
      future enhancement to tighten up resource accounting and
      perhaps allow removing the synchronous special case update.
    
    This functionality supercedes the previous approach using
    'euca-describe-availability-zones verbose' which will be
    deprecated in a subsequent release.
    
    The following tickets are addressed
    - EUCA-442  instance types can be set out of order
    - EUCA-6018 persisting changes to instance types
    - EUCA-5915 IAM policy checking
    - EUCA-5968 modification of instance types in the admin ui
    - EUCA-6041 upgrading of instances types using old values
    - EUCA-6042 adjust operation and parameter naming to prefer instance to vm
    - EUCA-6095 changes in admin ui are saved properly
    - EUCA-4529 api for retrieving instance type information
    - EUCA-3635 non-ui method for modifying instance types
    - EUCA-3056 instance types can be set out of order
Fix verified. User without permission cannot list VM types from CLI nor Admin Console
Flagging issue back to resolved.  Raised EUCA-6971 as the improvement of this issue.

*Assessment*

If using _ DescribeInstanceTypes_ in an IAM policy, the following error is returned:
{code}
$ euare-groupuploadpolicy -g user14 -p ec2-actions -f ec2-actions --region account2-admin@
euare-groupuploadpolicy: error (MalformedPolicyDocument): Error in uploaded policy: {
"Statement": [
{
"Sid": "Stmt1387900464014",
"Action": [
"ec2:AllocateAddress",
"ec2:AssociateAddress",
"ec2:AttachVolume",
"ec2:AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress",
"ec2:AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress",
"ec2:CreateKeyPair",
"ec2:CreateSecurityGroup",
"ec2:CreateSnapshot",
"ec2:CreateVolume",
"ec2:DeleteKeyPair",
"ec2:DeleteSecurityGroup",
"ec2:DeleteSnapshot",
"ec2:DeleteVolume",
"ec2:DescribeAddresses",
"ec2:DescribeAvailabilityZones",
"ec2:DescribeInstanceTypes",
"ec2:DescribeImages",
"ec2:DescribeInstances",
"ec2:DescribeKeyPairs",
"ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups",
"ec2:DescribeSnapshots",
"ec2:DescribeVolumes",
"ec2:DetachVolume",
"ec2:DisassociateAddress",
"ec2:GetConsoleOutput",
"ec2:RebootInstances",
"ec2:ReleaseAddress",
"ec2:RevokeSecurityGroupEgress",
"ec2:RevokeSecurityGroupIngress",
"ec2:RunInstances",
"ec2:TerminateInstances"
],
"Effect": "Allow",
"Resource": "*"
}
]
}
{code}

When looking in the cloud-error.log file, the following is seen:
{code}
Fri Jan 17 08:56:21 2014 ERROR [EuareService:Euare.49] [com.eucalyptus.auth.euare.EuareService.putGroupPolicy(EuareService.java):609] com.eucalyptus.auth.PolicyParseException: net.sf.json.JSONException: 'describeinstancetypes' does not match any defined action
com.eucalyptus.auth.PolicyParseException: net.sf.json.JSONException: 'describeinstancetypes' does not match any defined action
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parse(PolicyParser.java:162)

	at org.mule.processor.AsyncInterceptingMessageProcessor$AsyncMessageProcessorWorker.doRun(AsyncInterceptingMessageProcessor.java:184)
	at org.mule.work.AbstractMuleEventWork.run(AbstractMuleEventWork.java:43)
	at org.mule.work.WorkerContext.run(WorkerContext.java:311)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
Caused by: net.sf.json.JSONException: 'describeinstancetypes' does not match any defined action
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.checkAction(PolicyParser.java:366)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.decomposeStatement(PolicyParser.java:268)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parseAuthorizations(PolicyParser.java:253)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parseStatement(PolicyParser.java:202)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parseStatements(PolicyParser.java:177)
	at com.eucalyptus.auth.policy.PolicyParser.parse(PolicyParser.java:158)
	... 58 more
{code}

*Workaround*

The only way to control the  _ DescribeInstanceTypes_ action is by using _ DescribeInstance*_.
I'm making a note here that the outcome of this ought to be documented as an example in the "euca policy extensions" part of the docs.
[~sjones], please confirm this issue has been resolved in 4.0

From the looks of it EUCA-6971 should also not be marked as fixed because in that ticket we see that DescribeInstanceTypes been added as action , see commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/3f4b4d911d63afa1528631f92d8df1c81de7af1f

But it does not work. Please re-open EUCA-6971 as well. Not sure what was required to be QA'ed in EUCA-6971 but the commit message says something that does not work at the moment.

Fixed. Verified by testing several combination of IAM policies.
